result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik L Bednar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$1,000.00 cash bond to be applied to Case Nos. 15CM260 and 15CM67.
Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Huber and good time granted.
Consecutive to: Case No. 15CM67.

(Clerked by APavick)
Defendant Erik L Bednar in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 15CM60, 15CM447, 15CM67 AND 15CM260

15CM60:
Count #1:  State moves to amend to delete the domestic abuse enhancer.  Court grants motion.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count #2:  State moves to dismiss and read-in.  Court grants motion.

Imposed and stayed:  90 days jail with Huber and good time
1 year probation
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO
No contact with Michelle J. subject to approval of agent
Pay court costs (bond posted to apply)

15CM67:
Count #1:  State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants motion.
Count #2:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Pay court costs
15 days jail consecutive to 15CM260, with Huber privileges and credit for one day served. Report to jail today by 3:30 PM

15CM260:
Count #4:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Pay court costs
15 days county jail consecutive to 15CM67, with Huber and good time

 15CM447:
State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants motion.

Any cash posted in above cases to apply to court costs.

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.  Report immediately.
